body: @dr2chase By corresponding inverse, do you mean the `Add` function I mentioned?  If so, in [my unsafe.Pointer arithmetic proposal](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1yyCMzE4YPfsXvnZNjhszaYNqavxHhvbY-OWPqdzZK30/pub), I further suggested that `Add(p, n)` should only be guaranteed to be safe if the resulting pointer points into the same variable as p, which *is* checkable at runtime.
